title: kvkapiR
code: library(kvkapiR)

title: kvkapiR
text: access KvK API, need API key. can apply API key learn different KvK APIs KvK Developer Portal.

title: kvkapiR
text: need API key current session, use kvk_set_api_key() function. ⚠️ Note: sets key current R session. key lost restart R.
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here")

title: kvkapiR
text: persistent storage across R sessions, can manually add API key .Renviron file: Open .Renviron file: usethis::edit_r_environ() Add line: KVK_API_KEY=your_api_key_here Save file restart R ⚠️ Warning: store API key way can safely store system.

title: kvkapiR
text: kvk_search() function wrapper KvK Search API. automatically handles pagination retrieve available results, API limit 1,000 records. examples demonstrating perform searches handle API responses.

what: Example 1: single variable, less then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: Lets search KvK registrations village Koudum. Since small village fewer 1.000 registered businesses (API limit), records retrieved one request.
code: koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum") koudum #> # A tibble: 512 × 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc… <named list> neve… <list> #>  2 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve… <list> #>  3 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjehúske  <named list> neve… <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve… <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It Fûgelnêst             <named list> neve… <list> #>  6 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof… <list> #>  7 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof… <list> #>  8 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.… <named list> hoof… <list> #>  9 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en … <named list> hoof… <list> #> 10 41005555  000021707499     Stichting Jongerenwerk … <named list> hoof… <list> #> # ℹ 502 more rows

what: Example 2: single variable, more then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: city Rotterdam significantly larger Koudum. Searching registrations Rotterdam return 1,000 records, exceeding API limit. happens, warning displayed:
code: rotterdam <- kvk_search(plaats = "Rotterdam") #> ! API response contains more than 1000 results. Only the first 1000 will be retrieved. rotterdam #> # A tibble: 1,000 × 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 30019112  000022201726     Albron Campus Catering   <named list> neve… <list> #>  2 41126601  000023151153     Albert Schweitzer Groep… <named list> neve… <list> #>  3 24483298  000023336749     Klooster Afrikaander     <named list> neve… <list> #>  4 34360247  000022666397     UWV WERKbedrijf Rotterd… <named list> neve… <list> #>  5 24483298  000022493352     Gemeentewerken Rotterda… <named list> neve… <list> #>  6 24104827  000020343264     Simonis Verf B.V.        <named list> neve… <list> #>  7 24335233  000010150471     Shop Rosie               <named list> neve… <list> #>  8 24483298  000022962077     GGD Rotterdam-Rijnmond   <named list> neve… <list> #>  9 34238535  000060066164     Levéo Groep B.V.         <named list> neve… <list> #> 10 27295998  000059996013     Temporary Works Design … <named list> neve… <list> #> # ℹ 990 more rows

what: Example 3: combining multiple search terms in variables
title: kvkapiR
text: can combine multiple search terms parameter refine search. API treats multiple words within parameter operation default.
code: # Search for businesses with both "snackbar" and "hoekje" in their name snackbar_hoekje <- kvk_search(naam = "snackbar hoekje") snackbar_hoekje #> # A tibble: 17 × 7 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam       adres        type  links  vervallenNaam #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>      <list>       <chr> <list> <chr>         #>  1 01117517  000001223720     Snackbar … <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  2 08714826  000015163474     V.O.F. Sn… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  3 01034036  000005461081     Bar-Snack… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  4 67276644  000014002736     Café-Snac… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  5 27238930  000004196724     Snackbar … <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  6 04034441  000009116559     Klaver 4 … <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  7 01048627  000003587142     Snackwage… <named list> hoof… <list> "SNACKBAR 'T… #>  8 09053061  000006155480     Cafetaria… <named list> hoof… <list> "SNACKBAR 'T… #>  9 33167324  000003928373     Cafetaria… <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar/Av… #> 10 06046872  000014471450     Toon´s et… <named list> hoof… <list> "SNACKBAR 'T… #> 11 34148178  000002749122     Grillroom… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #> 12 81885326  000014587653     Snackbar … <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #> 13 01047770  000019937814     Jack's Ca… <named list> hoof… <list> "SNACKBAR \"… #> 14 01117517  NA               Snackbar … <NULL>       rech… <list>  NA           #> 15 08714826  NA               V.O.F. Sn… <NULL>       rech… <list>  NA           #> 16 06046872  NA               Toon´s et… <NULL>       rech… <list> "SNACKBAR 'T… #> 17 04034441  NA               Klaver 4 … <NULL>       rech… <list>  NA

title: kvkapiR
text: can combine multiple search criteria query. example, let’s search businesses Utrecht name contains snackbar hoek:
code: snackbar <- kvk_search(plaats = "Utrecht", naam = "snackbar") snackbar #> # A tibble: 17 × 7 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam       adres        type  links  vervallenNaam #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>      <list>       <chr> <list> <chr>         #>  1 30055828  000001534106     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  2 30149968  000001373366     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  3 30061168  000007852940     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  4 91479894  000057155518     "De Snack… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  5 77162838  000044881207     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  6 30048901  000015639428     "Snackbar… <named list> neve… <list>  NA           #>  7 63545659  000032452004     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  8 60975784  000028183169     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #>  9 91242894  000002767961     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA           #> 10 30083297  000009193693     "Cafetari… <named list> hoof… <list> "SNACKBAR HO… #> 11 30050751  000007808208     "Petit-Re… <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar \"… #> 12 30192953  000002554313     "Cafetari… <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar de… #> 13 30156975  000013513508     "Bestaria… <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar \"… #> 14 86470833  000005957397     "Giros"    <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar Gi… #> 15 29036082  000020552270     "Restaura… <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar de… #> 16 76537293  000044313047     "Biltstra… <named list> hoof… <list> "Snackbar de… #> 17 76449548  000044233884     "Snackbar… <named list> hoof… <list>  NA

title: kvkapiR
text: API allows filtering business type using type parameter. can search : hoofdvestiging (main branch) nevenvestiging (secondary branch) rechtspersoon (legal entity) can also combine multiple types passing type parameter multiple times:
code: # Search for both main branches AND legal entities in Amsterdam mixed_types <- kvk_search(   plaats = "Amsterdam",   type = "hoofdvestiging",   type = "rechtspersoon" ) #> ! API response contains more than 1000 results. Only the first 1000 will be retrieved. mixed_types #> # A tibble: 1,000 × 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 41208816  000022202625     Stichting tot Behoud va… <named list> hoof… <list> #>  2 52255786  000022204849     Groenhoed Servicios Y C… <named list> hoof… <list> #>  3 52257673  000022206469     Ponooc B.V.              <named list> hoof… <list> #>  4 52800636  000022712550     Werf 't Kromhout B.V.    <named list> hoof… <list> #>  5 53190173  000023069244     Maxje-Saar B.V.          <named list> hoof… <list> #>  6 53256417  000000970077     Boeketterie Wendy        <named list> hoof… <list> #>  7 53225279  000023105658     AAC Rijsnel              <named list> hoof… <list> #>  8 53034015  000022921362     Borealis Staete Partici… <named list> hoof… <list> #>  9 41200805  000021790221     Kath. St. Bevordering v… <named list> hoof… <list> #> 10 52117839  000022081356     MIH PayU B.V.            <named list> hoof… <list> #> # ℹ 990 more rows

title: kvkapiR
text: can search businesses specific address using different combinations:

title: kvkapiR
code: # Search businesses at a specific address secret_address <- kvk_search(postcode = "2594BD", huisnummer = "10") secret_address #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam    adres            type           links      #>   <chr>     <chr>            <chr>   <list>           <chr>          <list>     #> 1 57096317  000028603745     politie <named list [1]> nevenvestiging <list [2]>

S… <named list> hoof… <list> #>  9 80942598  000047272619     JDMD Holding B.V.        <named list> hoof… <list> #> 10 27185211  000003272141     Van Rijn Holding B.V.    <named list> hoof… <list> #> # ℹ 657 more rows

title: kvkapiR
text: package provides functions retrieve three types detailed profiles API: Basisprofiel (Basic Profile) - General company information Vestigingsprofiel (Establishment Profile) - Detailed branch/location information Naamgeving (Name History) - Historical company names 💰 Note: profile retrieval costs EUR 0.02 per call (except government organizations - see ).

title: kvkapiR
text: basic profile contains general company information:
code: # Get basic profile for a social organization (Stichting Gemeenschapscentrum Koudum) stichting_profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "01036576") stichting_profile #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     materieleRegistratie…¹ totaalWerkzamePersonen #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                                   <int> #> 1 01036576  Nee           Stichti… 19660217                                    5 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​materieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ℹ 5 more variables: statutaireNaam <chr>, handelsnamen <list>, #> #   sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, `_embedded` <list>

title: kvkapiR
text: establishment profile provides detailed information specific location, including geographical data:
code: # Get establishment profile for the same organization stichting_vestiging <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000007810083") stichting_vestiging #> # A tibble: 1 × 16 #>   vestigingsnummer kvkNummer rsin      indNonMailing materieleRegistratie$datu…¹ #>   <chr>            <chr>     <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                       #> 1 000007810083     01036576  002897295 Nee           19840825                    #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​materieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ℹ 11 more variables: statutaireNaam <chr>, eersteHandelsnaam <chr>, #> #   indHoofdvestiging <chr>, indCommercieleVestiging <chr>, #> #   voltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   deeltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, handelsnamen <list>, adressen <list>, #> #   sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>  # The vestigingsprofiel contains geographical data for mapping and analysis # Access coordinates through the nested 'adressen' column: if (nrow(stichting_vestiging) > 0 && length(stichting_vestiging$adressen[[1]]) > 0) {   address_data <- stichting_vestiging$adressen[[1]]   if ("geoData" %in% names(address_data)) {     geo_info <- address_data$geoData     cat("Geographical coordinates available for mapping and spatial analysis\n")   } }

title: kvkapiR
text: name history shows historical names company:
code: # Get name history stichting_names <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "01036576") stichting_names #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   kvkNummer rsin      statutaireNaam         naam  startdatum vestigingen links  #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                  <chr> <chr>      <list>      <list> #> 1 01036576  002897295 Stichting Gemeenschap… Stic… 19660217   <list [2]>  <list>

title: kvkapiR
text: kvkapiR package includes automatic session-based usage tracking help monitor API calls costs within current R session.

title: kvkapiR
text: Use kvk_usage_report() see current session’s API usage costs: different output formats serve different purposes: “summary” (default): Human-readable overview session costs totals “tibble”: Structured summary session usage “detailed”: One row per API call, perfect detailed analysis report shows current session costs: - Per-query costs: EUR 0.02 profile retrievals (search calls free) - Total session costs call counts type
code: # View summary report (default format) kvk_usage_report() #>  #> ── KvK API Usage Report - Current Session ── #>  #> ── API Calls #> • Search calls (free): 7 #> • Profile calls (EUR 0.02 each): 3 #> • Total calls: 10 #>  #> ── Session Costs #> • Paid API calls: 3 x EUR 0.02 = EUR 0.06 #>   # Get structured tibble format for data analysis usage_data <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tibble") usage_data #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   Search Basisprofiel Vestiging Naamgeving `Total Calls` `Costs (EUR)` #>    <int>        <int>     <int>      <int>         <int>         <dbl> #> 1      7            1         1          1            10          0.06  # Get detailed format with one row per API call usage_detailed <- kvk_usage_report(format = "detailed") usage_detailed #> # A tibble: 10 × 6 #>    timestamp           date        year month call_type         test_environment #>    <dttm>              <date>     <int> <int> <chr>             <lgl>            #>  1 2025-06-22 21:09:16 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  2 2025-06-22 21:09:20 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  3 2025-06-22 21:09:20 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  4 2025-06-22 21:09:21 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  5 2025-06-22 21:09:24 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  6 2025-06-22 21:09:24 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  7 2025-06-22 21:09:26 2025-06-22  2025     6 search            FALSE            #>  8 2025-06-22 21:09:26 2025-06-22  2025     6 basisprofiel      FALSE            #>  9 2025-06-22 21:09:27 2025-06-22  2025     6 vestigingsprofiel FALSE            #> 10 2025-06-22 21:09:27 2025-06-22  2025     6 naamgeving        FALSE

title: kvkapiR
text: Protect unexpected costs session-based usage alerts: Alert features: Paid calls : Call limits apply paid API calls (basisprofiel, vestigingsprofiel, naamgeving) Search calls free: Search calls don’t count towards call limits Session-based: Alerts apply current R session Real-time: Immediate notification limits exceeded
code: # Set session cost limit of EUR 5.00 kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 5.00) #> ✔ Max cost: EUR 5.00 for this session  # Set session limit for paid API calls only (search calls don't count) kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 100) #> ✔ Max paid calls: 100 for this session  # Set both limits for your current session kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 100, max_cost = 5.00) #> ✔ Max paid calls: 100 for this session #> ✔ Max cost: EUR 5.00 for this session  # Disable all alerts for this session kvk_usage_alert() #> ✔ All usage alerts have been disabled for this session

title: kvkapiR
text: Export session usage data external analysis:
code: # Export session summary (default) kvk_export_usage("session_summary.csv")  # Export detailed call data (one row per API call) kvk_export_usage("detailed_calls.csv", format = "detailed")

title: kvkapiR
text: Session-Based Design: kvkapiR uses session-based usage tracking privacy features: Session : usage data stored memory current R session File Storage: data written computer’s file system External Transmission: Nothing sent external servers Automatic Reset: tracking data cleared restart R Control Options:
code: # Disable tracking completely Sys.setenv(KVKAPI_DISABLE_TRACKING = "true")  # Clear current session usage data kvk_reset_usage()

title: kvkapiR
text: ⚠️ Important: costs mentioned charged Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) API usage. costs may change future, updates reflected future versions package.

title: kvkapiR
text: Monthly base fee: EUR 6.20 (charged API access) Search API: Free (base fee) Profile APIs: EUR 0.02 per call (basisprofiel, vestigingsprofiel, naamgeving)

title: kvkapiR
text: Important: authorized business representatives can apply API access sign contracts KvK. Private individuals register API access. Authorized representatives include: - Business owners (sole proprietorships) - Directors companies (BV, NV) - Board members foundations associations - Partners partnerships (VOF, CV, Maatschap) - Authorized signatories full limited authority

title: kvkapiR
text: Government organizations exempt API costs can use APIs without incurring charges.

title: kvkapiR
text: KvK provides test environment can experiment API using production. information available KvK documentation page. search profile retrieval functions kvkapiR support testing mode via test_environment argument, set FALSE default. 🦆 Tip: test environment contains fictional data based characters Dutch comic magazine “Donald Duck”. Try searching names like “Donald” “Dagobert” see API works sample data. test environment: Uses different base URL: https://api.kvk.nl/test/api/ Contains fictional business data testing purposes require API key (package uses built-test key) functionality endpoints production incur costs count towards usage tracking Displays informative messages API call, indicating test environment usage Note: using test environment, API call displays message like:
code: ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned.

title: kvkapiR
code: # Search in test environment - no API key needed # Note: You'll see a message indicating test environment usage test_results <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald", test_environment = TRUE) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_results #> # A tibble: 3 × 6 #>   kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                      adres        type  links  #>   <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                     <list>       <chr> <list> #> 1 68750110  000037178601     Test BV Donald Nevenvest… <named list> neve… <list> #> 2 68750110  000037178598     Test BV Donald            <named list> hoof… <list> #> 3 68750110  NA               Test BV Donald            <NULL>       rech… <list>  # Get test profiles - no costs incurred donald <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald", test_environment = TRUE) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_basisprofiel <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(   kvkNummer = donald$kvkNummer[1],    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_basisprofiel #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda…¹ materieleRegistratie…² #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 68750110  Ja            Test BV… 20170519               20170519               #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​formeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ²​materieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ℹ 6 more variables: totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, #> #   `_embedded` <list>  test_vestigingsprofiel <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer = donald$vestigingsnummer[1],    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_vestigingsprofiel #> # A tibble: 1 × 17 #>   vestigingsnummer kvkNummer rsin      indNonMailing formeleRegistratiedatum #>   <chr>            <chr>     <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                   #> 1 000037178601     68750110  857587973 Ja            20170519                #> # ℹ 12 more variables: materieleRegistratie <tibble[,1]>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   eersteHandelsnaam <chr>, indHoofdvestiging <chr>, #> #   indCommercieleVestiging <chr>, voltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, deeltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, adressen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>  test_naamgeving <- kvk_get_naamgeving(   kvkNummer = donald$kvkNummer[1],    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_naamgeving #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   kvkNummer rsin      statutaireNaam naam          startdatum vestigingen links  #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>          <chr>         <chr>      <list>      <list> #> 1 68750110  857587973 Test BV Donald Test BV Dona… 20170519   <list [2]>  <list>

title: kvkapiR
text: kvkapiR package provides comprehensive interface accessing KvK business data R : Simple authentication management Full API coverage (search profile retrieval) Test environment support development Session-based usage tracking cost monitoring Flexible search options including multiple filters Real-time usage alerts smart filtering (paid calls ) Government organization fee exemption Privacy-focused design permanent file storage details, refer official KvK API documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Coen Eisma. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eisma C (2025). kvkapiR: Interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) API. R package version 0.1.2, https://coeneisma.github.io/kvkapiR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kvkapiR: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API},   author = {Coen Eisma},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://coeneisma.github.io/kvkapiR/}, }

what: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: goal kvkapiR provide convenient R programming language interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) APIs. package built using httr2 package follows best practices wrapping APIs R, outlined httr2 documentation. simplifies authentication, request handling, response parsing interacting KvK API. package provides access KvK APIs: KvK Search API KvK Basisprofiel API KvK Vestigingsprofiel API KvK Naamgeving API details can found developers website KvK.

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: package submitted CRAN review. ’s accepted CRAN status badge shows “CRAN: OK”, can install stable version CRAN : , can install current stable version GitHub : install latest development version:
code: install.packages("kvkapiR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR", ref = "development")

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: use KvK API, need API key. can apply one KvK Developer Portal.
code: # Set API key for current session kvk_set_api_key("your_api_key_here")  # Or add to .Renviron file manually: # KVK_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: package includes support KvK test environment fictional Donald Duck data:
code: # No API key needed for test environment test_results <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald Duck", test_environment = TRUE)

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API

Search by address address_search <- kvk_search(postcode = "2594BD", huisnummer = "10")  # Filter by business type (multiple types allowed) mixed_types <- kvk_search(   plaats = "Amsterdam",   type = "hoofdvestiging",   type = "rechtspersoon" ) #> ! API response contains more than 1000 results. Only the first 1000 will be retrieved.

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: profile retrieval costs EUR 0.02 (free government organizations):
code: # Get basic company profile (using a social organization) profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel("01036576")  # Get establishment details establishment <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel("000007810083")  # Get name history names <- kvk_get_naamgeving("01036576")

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: package includes automatic session-based usage tracking:
code: # View current session usage kvk_usage_report()  # Set session alerts kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 5.00)  # Export session data kvk_export_usage("session_usage.csv")

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: Monthly base fee: EUR 6.20 (API access) Search API: Free (base fee) Profile APIs: EUR 0.02 per call Government organizations: API calls free Access requirement: authorized business representatives can apply

what: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
title: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
text: Export KvK API usage data current session CSV file external analysis, reporting, record keeping. Choose summary data detailed call--call data.

title: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
code: kvk_export_usage(file_path, format = "summary")

title: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
text: file_path Character string specifying path CSV file saved. Can include relative absolute paths. file created exist, overwritten . format Character string specifying export format: "summary" (default): Session summary call counts type total costs. Ideal quick reporting budget tracking. "detailed": One row per API call detailed information including timestamp, date, call type, metadata. Perfect creating custom visualizations detailed analysis.

title: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effect creating CSV file.

title: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
text: exported data includes production API calls current R session. Test environment calls included export. data session-based lost restart R. Summary format includes columns: Search, Basisprofiel, Vestiging, Naamgeving: Call counts type Total Calls: Total number API calls session Costs (EUR): Session costs (EUR 0.02 per paid call) Detailed format includes columns: timestamp: Exact time API call date: Date API call year, month: Extracted date components call_type: Type API call (search, basisprofiel, etc.) test_environment: Always FALSE production calls

title: Export session usage data to CSV file — kvk_export_usage
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Export session summary (default) kvk_export_usage("session_summary.csv")  # Export detailed call data for analysis kvk_export_usage("detailed_calls.csv", format = "detailed")  # Export to specific directory kvk_export_usage("reports/session_data.csv", format = "summary") }

what: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function retrieves basis profile given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Basisprofiel API. Users can also request additional data, owner information, main establishment, locations specifying include parameter.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: kvk_get_basisprofiel(   kvkNummer,   geoData = FALSE,   include = NULL,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number basis profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. include character vector specifying additional data include. Possible values: "eigenaar" (owner), "hoofdvestiging" (main establishment), "vestigingen" (locations). Defaults NULL (basic profile ). test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved basis profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Basisprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. include parameter allows users request additional details, ownership information business locations. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number — kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) # Retrieve basis profile for a given KvK number without geo-data basis_profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084") print(basis_profile) #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda…¹ materieleRegistratie…² #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 69599084  Nee           Flexmet… 20180302               20170914               #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​formeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ²​materieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ℹ 6 more variables: materieleRegistratie$datumEinde <chr>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, #> #   links <list>, `_embedded` <list>  # Retrieve basis profile with geo-data basis_profile_geo <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084", geoData = TRUE)  # Retrieve basis profile including owner information basis_profile_owner <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084", include = "eigenaar")  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) # These use the KvK test dataset with Donald Duck themed businesses basis_profile_test <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "68727720", test_environment = TRUE) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(basis_profile_test) #> # A tibble: 1 × 11 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda…¹ materieleRegistratie…² #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 68727720  Ja            Test NV… 20170516               20160516               #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​formeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ²​materieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ℹ 6 more variables: totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, #> #   `_embedded` <list>

what: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
text: function retrieves name information (naamgeving) given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Naamgevingen API.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
code: kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer, test_environment = FALSE)

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number name information requested. test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
text: tibble containing retrieved name information.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Naamgevingen API. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number — kvk_get_naamgeving
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) # Retrieve naamgeving for a given KvK number naamgeving <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "68750110") print(naamgeving) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   kvkNummer naam     startdatum vestigingen links      #>   <chr>     <chr>    <chr>      <list>      <list>     #> 1 68750110  Bikerfix 20170512   <list [1]>  <list [2]>  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) naamgeving_test <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "68727720", test_environment = TRUE) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(naamgeving_test) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   kvkNummer rsin      statutaireNaam         naam  startdatum vestigingen links  #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                  <chr> <chr>      <list>      <list> #> 1 68727720  857567433 Test NV Katrien - Sta… Test… 20160516   <list [1]>  <list>

what: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: function retrieves establishment profile (vestigingsprofiel) given establishment number (vestigingsnummer) using KvK Vestigingsprofiel API.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
code: kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer,   geoData = FALSE,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: vestigingsnummer string representing establishment number profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved establishment profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Vestigingsprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number — kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number vestigingsprofiel <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000038509504") print(vestigingsprofiel) #> # A tibble: 1 × 15 #>   vestigingsnummer kvkNummer indNonMailing formeleRegistratiedatum #>   <chr>            <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                   #> 1 000038509504     70215065  Ja            20171204                #> # ℹ 11 more variables: materieleRegistratie <tibble[,1]>, #> #   eersteHandelsnaam <chr>, indHoofdvestiging <chr>, #> #   indCommercieleVestiging <chr>, voltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, deeltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, adressen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>  # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel with geo-data vestigingsprofiel_geo <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer = "000038509504",    geoData = TRUE )  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) vestigingsprofiel_test <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer = "000019716893",    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. #> ℹ The product cannot be delivered for branch number '000019716893' (HTTP 404) print(vestigingsprofiel_test) #> NULL

what: Reset session usage tracking data — kvk_reset_usage
title: Reset session usage tracking data — kvk_reset_usage
text: Clear API usage data current R session. action undone reset session usage history including call counts, timestamps, cost calculations.

title: Reset session usage tracking data — kvk_reset_usage
code: kvk_reset_usage()

title: Reset session usage tracking data — kvk_reset_usage
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effect clearing session usage data.

title: Reset session usage tracking data — kvk_reset_usage
text: function clears session-based usage tracking data stored memory. reset: session usage history cleared kvk_usage_report show data Session cost calculations restart zero Usage alerts continue new baseline function affects session usage data. change: Usage alert settings (stored R options) API key configuration Package preferences can useful : Starting fresh tracking within long R session Clearing test data production use Resetting session counters specific analyses Troubleshooting usage tracking issues

title: Reset session usage tracking data — kvk_reset_usage
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Clear session usage history kvk_reset_usage()  # Verify reset worked kvk_usage_report()  # Should show "No usage data found"  # Usage tracking will restart with new API calls results <- kvk_search(plaats = "Amsterdam") kvk_usage_report()  # Will show the new call }

what: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
text: function automatically paginates KvK API collect available results. Due API limitations, retrieves maximum 1,000 records. happens, warning displayed.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
code: kvk_search(..., test_environment = FALSE)

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
text: ... Named arguments passed API query (e.g., naam = "Koudum"). Available arguments can found https://developers.kvk.nl/documentation/zoeken-api#input. test_environment logical value. TRUE, uses test environment instead live API. Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
text: tibble containing retrieved results. Possible parameters can found Results section https://developers.kvk.nl/documentation/zoeken-api#output.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
text: test_environment = TRUE, switches KvK's test environment, using mock API key testing purposes.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) — kvk_search
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum") print(koudum) #> # A tibble: 512 × 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc… <named list> neve… <list> #>  2 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve… <list> #>  3 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjehúske  <named list> neve… <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve… <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It Fûgelnêst             <named list> neve… <list> #>  6 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof… <list> #>  7 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof… <list> #>  8 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.… <named list> hoof… <list> #>  9 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en … <named list> hoof… <list> #> 10 41005555  000021707499     Stichting Jongerenwerk … <named list> hoof… <list> #> # ℹ 502 more rows  rotterdam <- kvk_search(plaats = "Rotterdam") #> ! API response contains more than 1000 results. Only the first 1000 will be retrieved. print(rotterdam) #> # A tibble: 1,000 × 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 30019112  000022201726     Albron Campus Catering   <named list> neve… <list> #>  2 41126601  000023151153     Albert Schweitzer Groep… <named list> neve… <list> #>  3 24483298  000023336749     Klooster Afrikaander     <named list> neve… <list> #>  4 34360247  000022666397     UWV WERKbedrijf Rotterd… <named list> neve… <list> #>  5 24483298  000022493352     Gemeentewerken Rotterda… <named list> neve… <list> #>  6 24104827  000020343264     Simonis Verf B.V.        <named list> neve… <list> #>  7 24335233  000010150471     Shop Rosie               <named list> neve… <list> #>  8 24483298  000022962077     GGD Rotterdam-Rijnmond   <named list> neve… <list> #>  9 34238535  000060066164     Levéo Groep B.V.         <named list> neve… <list> #> 10 27295998  000059996013     Temporary Works Design … <named list> neve… <list> #> # ℹ 990 more rows  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) test_data <- kvk_search(plaats = "Utrecht", test_environment = TRUE) #> ℹ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(test_data) #> # A tibble: 24 × 6 #>    kvkNummer naam                     adres        type  links  vestigingsnummer #>    <chr>     <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> <chr>            #>  1 59581883  Kamer van Koophandel     <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  2 90000218  Stichting Global Hotsol… <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  3 90006631  Soud'Or B.V.             <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  4 92040373  Facility Manager         <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  5 90006712  VoorUBO B.V.             <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  6 92040292  Sociale werkplaats       <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  7 92040322  Woningbouwer             <named list> rech… <list> NA               #>  8 59581883  Kamer van Koophandel     <named list> hoof… <list> 000015063097     #>  9 90000633  Stichting Grand Bigelec… <named list> hoof… <list> 990000552513     #> 10 90004574  Grand Alphaway B.V.      <named list> hoof… <list> 990000066710     #> # ℹ 14 more rows

what: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
title: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
text: function sets specified KvK API key current R session using Sys.setenv(). key available session ends.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key)

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
text: api_key string containing API key.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
text: Invisibly returns TRUE key set.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
text: function sets API key using Sys.setenv(), making available current session . store API key permanently across R sessions, add following line .Renviron file: KVK_API_KEY=l7xxYourActualApiKeyHere1234567890abcdef can edit .Renviron file running: usethis::edit_r_environ() adding key, restart R changes take effect.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session — kvk_set_api_key
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Set the API key for the current session kvk_set_api_key("abcd1234")  # To store permanently, add this line to .Renviron: # KVK_API_KEY=your_actual_api_key_here }

what: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
title: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
text: Configure automatic alerts monitor KvK API usage within current R session. Alerts triggered real-time exceed specified limits API calls.

title: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
code: kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = NULL, max_cost = NULL)

title: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
text: max_calls Integer maximum number paid API calls triggering alerts, NULL disable call alerts. basisprofiel, vestigingsprofiel, naamgeving calls count towards limit. Search calls free count. reached, see danger alert. Continued usage beyond limit show reminder warnings. max_cost Numeric maximum cost euros triggering alerts, NULL disable cost alerts. example, 5.45 represents EUR 5.45. Costs calculated EUR 0.02 per paid API call (search calls free).

title: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
text: return value, called side effects. Sets usage alert options current session.

title: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
text: Usage alerts help control API consumption within current R session. limits exceeded, package displays informative messages: First alert: Danger alert limit first reached Reminder alerts: Warning messages continued usage limits Alert settings stored R options apply current session. alert configurations automatically reset restart R. disable alerts within current session, call function parameters set NULL: kvk_usage_alert(). production API calls count towards limits. Test environment calls ignored.

title: Set usage and cost alerts for current session — kvk_usage_alert
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Set session limit for paid calls only (search calls don't count) kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 100)  # Set session cost limit to EUR 5.00 kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 5.00)  # Set both paid call and cost limits (EUR 10.50) kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 500, max_cost = 10.50)  # Disable all alerts for this session kvk_usage_alert() }

what: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
title: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
text: Display return API usage statistics costs current R session. function helps monitor KvK API usage associated costs.

title: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
code: kvk_usage_report(format = "summary")

title: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
text: format Character string specifying output format: "summary" (default): Human-readable console output costs call counts session "tibble": Structured summary data tibble "detailed": Detailed data one row per API call, suitable analysis visualization

title: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
text: format = "summary": Invisible NULL (output printed console) format = "tibble": tibble session usage summary format = "detailed": tibble detailed call--call data

title: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
text: summary format displays API call counts costs current R session . usage data session-based reset restart R. Search calls free, profile calls cost EUR 0.02 . production API calls included reports. Test environment calls tracked.

title: Generate API usage report for current session — kvk_usage_report
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Display human-readable summary kvk_usage_report()  # Get structured summary as tibble summary_data <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tibble") print(summary_data)  # Get detailed call data for custom analysis call_data <- kvk_usage_report(format = "detailed") head(call_data) }

what: kvkapiR: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API — kvkapiR-package
title: kvkapiR: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API — kvkapiR-package
text: Access business registration data Dutch Chamber Commerce (Kamer van Koophandel, KvK) official API https://developers.kvk.nl/. Search companies name, location, registration number. Retrieve detailed business profiles, establishment information, company name histories. Built 'httr2' robust API interaction automatic pagination, error handling, usage tracking.

title: kvkapiR: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API — kvkapiR-package
text: Maintainer: Coen Eisma coeneisma@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: kvkapiR 0.1.2
text: First CRAN release.

title: kvkapiR 0.1.2
text: kvk_search() searches Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) business registry automatic pagination 1,000 results. kvk_get_basisprofiel(), kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(), kvk_get_naamgeving() retrieve detailed business profiles, establishment information, company name histories. kvk_usage_report() displays API usage statistics costs multiple output formats. kvk_usage_alert() sets usage cost limits real-time alerts. kvk_export_usage() exports usage data CSV detailed summary formats. kvk_reset_usage() clears usage tracking history. functions support test environment via test_environment = TRUE cost-free testing. Search functions support multiple business types single query street-search. Automatic error handling user-friendly messages Dutch IPD code translations.

title: kvkapiR 0.1.2
text: Session-based usage tracking (file system writes) CRAN compliance. Complete test suite 226+ tests covering functionality. Robust error handling IPD error code translations. Privacy-focused design optional tracking disable via environment variable.

title: kvkapiR 0.1.2
text: Added comprehensive vignette practical examples cost information. Added pkgdown website custom KvK color scheme.
